page.title: 17INDUSTRY - PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: One small commercial garden specialises in rare plants, and also sells bunches of garden flowers at the gate. Idehurst Nursery Garden, with one-and-three-quarters acres, two glasshouses and a large plastic- covered tunnel, grows mostly fuschias. It is worked by the owner and his wife. Nearby is a private kennels, breeding Doberman pups, owned and run by a woman. Crimbourne Farm is now a Stud Farm with a staff of four, and there is a Vet working from home. A phenomena of the 1980s is for boards to be displayed saying 'Bed and Breakfast'. The recession has not yet brought outright hardship to wealthy Sussex, but many people are feeling the financial pinch, and so prefer cheap night stopovers when travelling. The service is lucrative and very litle trouble.
